column4: I have a little problem : when I boot my system, fsck says a error in my root /dev/hda1 and that I have to run fsck manually ;
but, when I reboot in a Live CD and run fsck, it says that everything is fine
but, if I reboot in hard disk, same thing happens
it just needs to do a fsck check on boot.  Let me try to find the command hold up
someone else on here may know .  Can you boot the system in recovery mode or anything?
I'm on the system right now, I booted using a Live CD
can you boot to the hd though and not use the live disk?  Or does it halt at that error?
I can boot , the thing goes like this : fsck error -> root command prompt -> "exit" -> boot
shutdown -F  -r now
that will force a reboot and run fsck on the next boot to fix the problem.
hopefully.
great, thanks!!
make sure you use a capital F linux is case sensitive
well, the check failed :(
did you get an error or what it failed on?
well, the check in /dev/hda1 went fine, then checked all the other partitions fine, but after that, it puts " inconsistency on / with inodes " or something around that
seems that the problem is when it mounts, not when it runs the fsck
it says "UNEXPECTED INCONSISTENCY"
with uppercase and all
and it passes on a fsck from livecd?
totally, even with -f parameter
I did a check with fsck.ext3fs, with fsck alone, with and without -f and -v and everything is fine, says clean filesystem
